intro: Viridantha rzedowskiana, commonly known as the Mexican greenbrier, is a climbing shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Smilacaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. Its fruits are berries that mature to a red color, containing several seeds. Viridantha rzedowskiana is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
